005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype.adapter;
007
008import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.MetapathConstants;
009import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.atomic.INcNameItem;
010import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.qname.EQNameFactory;
011import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.qname.IEnhancedQName;
012import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.util.ObjectUtils;
013
014import java.util.List;
015import java.util.regex.Pattern;
016
017import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
018
019/**
020 * Support for the Metaschema <a href=
021 * "https://pages.nist.gov/metaschema/specification/datatypes/#ncname">ncname</a>
022 * data type.
023 */
024@Deprecated(since = "0.7.0")
025public class NcNameAdapter
026    extends AbstractStringAdapter<INcNameItem> {
027  @NonNull
028  private static final List<IEnhancedQName> NAMES = ObjectUtils.notNull(
029      List.of(
030          EQNameFactory.instance().newQName(MetapathConstants.NS_METAPATH, "ncname"),
031          // for backwards compatibility with original type name
032          EQNameFactory.instance().newQName(MetapathConstants.NS_METAPATH, "NCName")));
033  private static final Pattern NCNAME = Pattern.compile(String.format("^(\\p{L}|_)(\\p{L}|\\p{N}|[.\\-_])*$"));
034
035  /**
036   * Determine if the name is a non-colonized name.
037   *
038   * @param name
039   *          the name to test
040   * @return {@code true} if the name is not colonized, or {@code false} otherwise
041   */
042  public static boolean isNcName(@NonNull String name) {
043    return NCNAME.matcher(name).matches();
044  }
045
046  NcNameAdapter() {
047    super(INcNameItem.class, INcNameItem::cast);
048    // avoid general construction
049  }
050
051  @Override
052  public List<IEnhancedQName> getNames() {
053    return NAMES;
054  }
055
056  @Override
057  public String parse(String value) {
058    if (!isNcName(value)) {
059      throw new IllegalArgumentException(String.format("Value '%s' is not a valid ncname.", value));
060    }
061    return super.parse(value);
062  }
063
064  @Override
065  public INcNameItem newItem(Object value) {
066    String item = asString(value);
067    return INcNameItem.valueOf(item);
068  }
069}
